notes.p: The Platform allows for the installation, the updating and removal of Overlays and their contents.

slide.title: Overlay
slide.p: A directory (with some structure) that can contain:

list.item: Static Files (Erb Templates, XML, YAML, etc)

notes.p: What's an Overlay, you ask? It's simply a directory that may contain, extensions, cacheable objects, static files and other supporting code.
Overlays can also be hosted anywhere using SubVersion, Mercurial, Git or even Rsync.

slide.title: Self Publishing
slide.p: Release what you want, when you want to.

slide.title: Step 1: Generate an Overlay
slide.shell: $ ronin-gen overlay path/to/overlay ./lib/ ./lib/init.rb ./objects/ ./tasks/ ./Rakefile ./ronin.xml $ cd path/to/overlay $ ronin-gen extension my_ext ./lib/ ./lib/my_ext.rb ./lib/my_ext/ ./extension.rb ... hack hack hack ...

notes.p: Generate an Overlay using the ronin-gen command. As you can see a lib/ directory was created for misc Code, an objects/ directory for the Cacheable Objects and a ronin.xml file that describes the Overlay.
You can also generate extensions with the ronin-gen command.
Host it somewhere. Maybe host it on your own private server, again Overlays do not have to be public.
